snippet: In his 17th N.B.A. season, Carter has adapted his game, replacing acrobatic dunks with mostly long-range jumpers in a reserve role for the playoff-bound Memphis Grizzlies.
abstract: Memphis Grizzles guard Vince Carter, who quickly emerged as an NBA star when he entered the league in 1998, is now the fourth oldest player in NBA at 38 years old and has found joy in his role as a reserve.
lead_paragraph: In his 17th N.B.A. season, Carter has adapted his game, replacing acrobatic dunks with mostly long-range jumpers in a reserve role for the playoff-bound Memphis Grizzlies.

headline.main: At 38, Vince Carter Drifts to the 3-Point Line and Reinvents Himself
headline.print_headline: Carter, at 38, Extends His Range and His Career
